task.title: Creating RMF data sources
task.shortdesc: To access RMF Monitor III metrics in Grafana, you need to connect to the s by adding an RMF data source.

ul.li: You must have installed the RMF for z/OS Grafana plugin. See .
You must know the hostname and port number of .

step.cmd:
Go to Apps
Add RMF Data Source .
step.info: Alternatively, you can click Administration Data sources + Add new data source , then search for the IBM RMF to choose a data source type.

step.cmd: Enter a name for the data source in the Name field.
Set Default to ON to make the added data source the default one.

info.note: When you create new panels, the default data source is preselected.

step.cmd: Enter the details for the following fields in the HTTP section:

strow.stentry:
Enter the URL of the in this field.
The format of the URL is: http://hostname:port_number/path or https://hostname:port_number/path

Specify the duration, in seconds in this field, for which Grafana is allowed to wait for a connection to the DDS before it closes the connection.
The default value is 60.

step.cmd: Set the Skip TLS Verify option to ON if you are accepting any certificate presented by the DDS and any hostname listed in that certificate. However, this practice is not considered secure and is typically used in development or testing environments.

info.note: By default, the Skip TLS Verify option is set to OFF.

step.cmd: Set the Basic Auth option to ON to create the data source with basic authentication.
Enter the credentials of the in the User and Password fields.

info.note: The User and Password fields are visible only when you enable the basic authentication.

step.cmd: Specify the size of the cache (in MB) for the data source in the Size field.

info.note: The value must be greater than or equal to 128. The default value is 1024.

step.stepresult: The Data source is working message is displayed if the connection to DDS succeeds.

taskbody.result: You have added the RMF data source.

postreq.p: You can refer to the topic for information about RMF master dashboard and its features.
